metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11752 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It is possible to delete an IndexedDB key value and subsequently try to extract it during conversion. This results in a use-after-free and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 69, Thunderbird < 68.1, Thunderbird < 60.9, Firefox ESR < 60.9, and Firefox ESR < 68.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.1.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
